title: JPMorgan to Add Ukraine Bonds to Debt Index Despite War Threat
sub_head: Move could mean an inflow of nearly $270 million into Ukrainian bond market from passive investors
body:
Hundreds of millions of dollars from foreign investors are likely to flow into Ukrainian bonds next month despite the threat of war with Russia.
JPMorgan Chase & Co. is planning to add Ukraineâ€™s local-currency debt to a popular emerging-market bond index known as the GBI-EM. It will come into effect from March 31 with a weighting of 0.12%, according to an October 2021 note to clients, which said close to 70% of investors supported the move.
